title: 820-2936a no power
message:
820-2936a with water damage. Have no green light and already reflowed the smc. bad trace damage and missing pads on q5310 pins 4 and 5. replaced q5310 and ran jumper from pin 4 to f6905 and r5311 but still no power anywhere on board and no green light.

Also have jumper from pin 4 of u6901 to r6929 and pin 1 on u6900.

What to try next?

title: 820-2936a no power
message: 3V42 present? PPBUS voltage? If 3V42 is missing check voltage on D6990 pins.

title: 820-2936a no power
message: Which pins of D6990? Need all of them, also R6990. No short on 3V42?

title: 820-2936a no power
message:
All 3 pins are 0V

No short on 3v42

title: 820-2936a no power
message: Power to R6990 comes straight from the adapter so F6905 must be bad or broken trace to R6990.

title: 820-2936a no power
message: Replaced F6905 and still 0V on F6905 along with 0v on all pins of the dc in connector. Using a known good magsafe.

title: 820-2936a no power
message: Why did you replace F6905, just measure the voltage there. If there is really 0V there then there must be a short somewhere on the DCIN line shutting down the charger.

title: 820-2936a no power
message: Thoughtf6905 could be bad since you said if f6905 could be the cause of the problem. checked everything on dc in line and nothing is shorted

title: 820-2936a no power
message: Connect external power supply to magsafe and check current draw. Something must be shutting down the Apple charge with an overload else there would be at least a couple of volts on F6905.

title: 820-2936a no power
message: plugging in external power supply achieved a fan spin and green light. New issue now is ground of c7524 is boiling hot. Replaced c7524 and but still same issue. Gets so hot that the solder melts. Also r7524 was burned and replaced.

title: 820-2936a no power
message: I would say there is a short inside the board in C7524 area. RIP
